title: Spotify's Top 10 most streamed tracks
text:
Spotify's Top 10 most streamed tracks Tools 
  3:00 PM   3:00 PM EDT 
The following list represents the most streamed tracks on Spotify, based on the number of people who shared it divided by the number who listened to it, from Friday Oct. 2 to Thursday, Oct. 8, via Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter and Spotify. 
UNITED STATES 
1. Drake, "Hotline Bling" (Cash Money Records Inc.) 
2. The Weeknd, "The Hills" (Republic Records) 
3. Justin Bieber, "What Do You Mean?" (Def Jam Recordings) 
4. Drake, Future, "Jumpman" (Cash Money Records Inc.) 
5. The Weeknd, "Can't Feel My Face" (Republic Records) 
6. Fetty Wap, "679 (feat. Remy Boyz)" (300 Entertainment) 
7. Shawn Mendes, "Stitches" (Island Records) 
8. Fetty Wap, "Trap Queen" (300 Entertainment) 
9. Major Lazer, "Lean On (feat. MØ& DJ Snake)" (Mad Decent) 
10. Fetty Wap, "Again" (300 Entertainment) 
UNITED KINGDOM 
1. Justin Bieber, "What Do You Mean?" (Def Jam Recordings) 
2. Sigala, "Easy Love - Original Mix" (Ministry of Sound Recordings) 
3. The Weeknd, "Can't Feel My Face" (Republic Records) 
4. Calvin Harris, Disciples, "How Deep Is Your Love" (Sony Music Entertainment UK Limited) 
5. R. City , "Locked Away" (Kemosabe Records) 
6. Ellie Goulding, "On My Mind" (Polydor Ltd.) 
7. Drake, "Hotline Bling" (Cash Money Records Inc.) 
8. Pia Mia, "Do It Again" (Interscope Records) 
9. Jess Glynne, "Don't Be So Hard On Yourself" (Warner Music UK Limited) 
10. Major Lazer, "Lean On (feat. MØ& DJ Snake)" (Mad Decent) 
GLOBAL 
1. Justin Bieber, "What Do You Mean?" (Def Jam Recordings) 
2. The Weeknd, "Can't Feel My Face" (Republic Records) 
3. The Weeknd, "The Hills" (Republic Records) 
4. Major Lazer, "Lean On (feat. MØ& DJ Snake)" (Mad Decent) 
5. R. City , "Locked Away" (Kemosabe Records) 
6. Drake, "Hotline Bling" (Cash Money Records Inc.) 
7. Calvin Harris, Disciples, "How Deep Is Your Love" (Sony Music Entertainment UK Limited) 
8. Ellie Goulding, "On My Mind" (Polydor Ltd.) 
9. Shawn Mendes, "Stitches" (Island Records) 
10. Robin Schulz, "Sugar (feat. Francesco Yates)" (Warner Music Group Germany Holding GmbH) 
____
